Simple Model Module¶

A simple model of server with two clients.

tests.simple_model.CLIENT_IDLE_STATE = <total_space.State object>¶

Trivial state for the client agent.

tests.simple_model.CLIENT_WAIT_STATE = <total_space.State object>¶

Trivial state for the client agent.

class tests.simple_model.ClientAgent(*, name: str, state: total_space.State)¶

A simple client that talks with a singleton server.

static new(name: str) → tests.simple_model.ClientAgent¶

Create a client in the initial (idle) state.

class tests.simple_model.InvalidServerState(*, name: str, data: Any = None)¶

A server state that reports invalid errors, for tests.

validate() → Collection[str]¶

Return a hopefully empty collection of reasons the state is invalid.

tests.simple_model.SERVER_READY_STATE = <total_space.State object>¶

Trivial state for the server agent.

In general the server state data is a tuple of the names of the clients it got requests from.

We therefore could have had just a single state name.

Instead this uses a different name ready when the list is empty and busy when actually working on behalf of the 1st client in the tuple.

In general it is always possible to have a single state name and just place all the information in the data field.

However using clear state names makes it easier to understand the state machine logic.

tests.simple_model.SERVER_STATE¶

alias of total_space.State

class tests.simple_model.PartialServerAgent(*, name: str, state: total_space.State)¶

A partial server (for testing).

The server handles multiple clients, one at a time.

classmethod new(name: str) → total_space.Agent¶

Create a server in the initial (ready) state.

class tests.simple_model.FullServerAgent(*, name: str, state: total_space.State)¶

A full server.

tests.simple_model.flags(parser: argparse.ArgumentParser) → None¶

Add command line flags for testing partial and invalid models.

tests.simple_model.model(args: argparse.Namespace) → Collection[Agent]¶

Create a model given the command line flags.
